main event: An object at approximately 25,000 feet was observed on radar performing unusual aerobatic maneuvers over Bakersfield, California for 1 1/2 hours.
interesting points: The object was approximately 20 miles away and appeared to be performing aerobatic maneuvers not typical of a standard aircraft.
The object was described as a bright, round grapefruit shape with red, white, and yellow colors.
Military personnel observed the object for approximately 4 1/2 hours, noting that it remained in the same position with no movement.
There were no visual observations from the ground, and the senior director suggested that the object was a star blinking through cirrus clouds.
The report suggests a prozaic explanation for the sighting, hypothesizing that the object was a star visible through thin cirrus clouds.
sighted object: round grapefruit-shaped object with red, white, and yellow colors
